Legal_Issue: Credibility assessment, delay in claim, state protection
Governing_Law: Gender Guidelines, IRPA, international refugee law
Credibility_Assessment: Questioned due to inconsistencies in testimony
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, evidence of domestic abuse, state protection measures
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility, delay, availability of state protection
Application_Error: Failure to apply Gender Guidelines, dismissal of delay explanations, inadequate assessment of state protection
Application_Factor: Gender-based violence, personal trauma, systemic barriers
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Errors in law and fact regarding credibility and state protection
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility, unexplained delay, belief in effective state protection
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of documentary evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to properly consider Gender Guidelines and applicant's explanations
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unfairness and misapplication of law
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (indirectly)
Procedural_Issue: Insufficient reasoning, failure to address key evidence
Omission_Type: Failure to consider Gender Guidelines, disregard of contradictory evidence
